xxl.core.io.converters
Class IntegerArrayConverter

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.io.converters.Converter<T>
      xxl.core.io.converters.SizeConverter<int[]>
          xxl.core.io.converters.IntegerArrayConverter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class IntegerArrayConverter
extends SizeConverter<int[]>

This class provides a converter that is able to read and write arrays of int values. First the converter reads or writes the length of the int array. Thereafter the int values are read or written.

Example usage (1). 

   // create an int array
   
   int[] array = {42, 4711, 666, 190, 77};
   
   // create a byte array output stream
   
   ByteArrayOutputStream output = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
   
   // write array to the output stream
   
   IntegerArrayConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.write(new DataOutputStream(output), array);
   
   // create a byte array input stream on the output stream
   
   ByteArrayInputStream input = new ByteArrayInputStream(output.toByteArray());
   
   // reset the array
   
   array = null;
   
   // read array from the input stream
   
   array = IntegerArrayConverter.DEFAULT_INSTANCE.read(new DataInputStream(input));
   
   // print the array
   
   for (int i : array)
       System.out.println(i);
       
   // close the streams after use
   
   input.close();
   output.close();

See Also:
DataInput, DataOutput, IOException, Serialized Form

Field Detail

DEFAULT_INSTANCE

public static final IntegerArrayConverter DEFAULT_INSTANCE
This instance can be used for getting a default instance of an integer array converter. It is similar to the Singleton Design Pattern (for further details see Creational Patterns, Prototype in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides) except that there are no mechanisms to avoid the creation of other instances of an integer array converter.

arraySize

protected int arraySize
Determines the length of the array. If it is -1, then the size information is also serialized.

Constructor Detail

IntegerArrayConverter

public IntegerArrayConverter(int arraySize)
Constructors an integer array converter which not necessarily serializes/deserializes the length of the array.

Parameters:
arraySize - if -1 then the size is not serialized/deserialized. Else this int value represents the number of elements which are serialized/deserialized.

IntegerArrayConverter

public IntegerArrayConverter()
Constructors an integer array converter which also serializes/deserializes the length of the array.

Method Detail

getSizeForArray

public static int getSizeForArray(boolean withLengthInfo,
                                  int length)
Determines the length of the conversion of an int array.

Parameters:
withLengthInfo - has to be true iff the length info of the array has to be stored.
length - the length of the array to be stored.
Returns:
the length of the conversion of an int array in bytes.

read

public int[] read(java.io.DataInput dataInput,
                  int[] object)
           throws java.io.IOException
Reads an array of int values from the specified data input and returns the restored int array.

When the specified int array is null this implementation returns a new array of int values, otherwise the size of the specified int array has to be sufficient.

Specified by:
read in class Converter<int[]>
Parameters:
dataInput - the stream to read the int array from.
object - the int array to be restored.
Returns:
the read array of int values.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if I/O errors occur.

write

public void write(java.io.DataOutput dataOutput,
                  int[] object)
           throws java.io.IOException
Writes the specified array of int values to the specified data output.

This implementation first writes the length of the array to the data output. Thereafter the int values are written.

Specified by:
write in class Converter<int[]>
Parameters:
dataOutput - the stream to write the int array to.
object - the int array that should be written to the data output.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - includes any I/O exceptions that may occur.
